Kongthong – The Whistling Village of MeghalayaJoin our travel community for the latest tips, guides, and exclusive offers!Subscribe You have already subscribed our newsletter!Thanks for Subscribing our newsletter!Nestled in the lap of nature, the Hill Stations in Meghalaya are a perfect getaway for those planning a refreshing Meghalaya vacation. Known as the “Abode of Clouds,” this state offers stunning landscapes, mist-covered hills, and scenic valleys in Meghalaya that captivate nature lovers and adventurers alike. From cascading waterfalls to picturesque mountain views, this state is filled with incredible places to visit in Meghalaya that promise peace and beauty at every turn. Some of the popular Meghalaya Hill Station, such as Shillong, Cherrapunji, and Mawsynram, invite travelers to explore their unique charm, cool climate, and breathtaking scenery. Whether it’s the living root bridges of Cherrapunji, the vibrant city life of Shillong, or the record-breaking rains of Mawsynram, these destinations make Meghalaya an unforgettable experience for all.Plan your visit and discover the magic of the top hill stations in Meghalaya!Here are some of the Top Hill Station Places in Meghalaya for you to visit:1. Shillong – The Scotland of the EastLocated amidst the lush green hills in Meghalaya, Shillong is one of the most famous hill stations of Meghalaya and a top tourist destination in Northeast India. This Meghalaya hill station is known for its colonial charm, cool weather, and scenic beauty, the city is surrounded by rolling hills, waterfalls, and glittering lakes. Some of the places to visit in Shillong include Umiam Lake, Ward’s Lake, Shillong Peak, and Elephant Falls. The city also boasts vibrant local markets, lively festivals, and cozy cafes in Shillong, offering a perfect mix of tradition and modernity.Why Visit:Enjoy breathtaking views of valleys and hills in Meghalaya.Explore iconic spots like Shillong Peak and Lady Hydari Park.Experience the culture through local music, art, and food.Visit beautiful waterfalls like Elephant and Sweet Falls.Relax in charming cafes in Shillong with local and international flavors.Top Things to Do in Shillong:Boating at Umiam Lake.Shop for handicrafts at Police Bazaar.Hike to Shillong Peak for panoramic views.Visit Don Bosco Museum for cultural insights.Day Excursion to explore Mawphlang Sacred Forest.Enjoy live music at Shillong’s local pubs and cafes.Best Time to Visit:March to June and September to November are ideal for visiting Shillong. The weather is pleasant, perfect for sightseeing and exploring nature. Avoid heavy monsoon months as rainfall can disrupt travel plans.Location and How to Reach:Shillong is 99 km from Guwahati. You can reach it by road via taxis or buses from Guwahati Airport or Railway Station.Read More: River Rafting in Meghalaya2. Cherrapunji – The Land of Living Root BridgesLocated in the heart of the hills in Meghalaya, Cherrapunji, or Sohra, is one of the most famous hill stations to visit near Shillong. Cherrapunji is one of the top hill station places in Meghalaya, famous for being one of the wettest places on Earth. It offers visitors dramatic views of rain-soaked cliffs and misty valleys.Known for its mesmerizing waterfalls, lush green landscapes, and unique natural wonders, it is a haven for nature lovers. Some iconic places to visit in Cherrapunji include Nohkalikai Falls, Seven Sisters Falls, and the famous Living Root Bridges—true engineering marvels created by nature and locals.Why Visit:Witness the awe-inspiring beauty of Nohkalikai, India’s tallest plunge waterfall.Explore the world-famous Living Root Bridges.Enjoy trekking through lush trails surrounded by forests and caves.Experience the charm of rain-kissed landscapes.Visit mesmerizing caves like Mawsmai and Arwah Caves.Top Things to Do in Cherrapunji:Trek to the Double Decker Living Root Bridge at Nongriat.Explore Mawsmai Caves, known for their fascinating limestone formations.Discover the lifestyle of the people living in Mawlynnong – the cleanest village in Asia.Walk through the Khasi villages to experience the local culture.Visit the Thangkharang Park for stunning views of the Bangladeshi plains.Best Time to Visit:October to April is the best time to visit Cherrapunji, as the weather is cool and pleasant for sightseeing. While monsoon months (June to September) bring heavy rainfall, they reveal the area’s lush beauty, making it perfect for waterfall enthusiasts.Location and How to Reach:Cherrapunji is 54 km from Shillong and can be reached by road via private taxis or buses. The nearest airport and railway station are in Guwahati.3. Mawsynram – The Wettest Place on EarthMawsynram holds the title of being the wettest place on Earth, with its record-breaking rainfall, making it one of the best hill stations to visit near Shillong. It is one of the top hill stations in Meghalaya, offering spectacular natural beauty, peaceful surroundings, and unique attractions. From lush valleys and mist-covered hills to caves and waterfalls, this Meghalaya hill station is perfect for nature enthusiasts and adventure seekers. Some of the must-visit spots include Mawjymbuin Cave, known for its stalagmite formations, and the lush green Mawphlang Sacred Forest.Why Visit:Experience the thrill of visiting the world’s wettest place.Explore the ancient Mawjymbuin Cave in Meghalaya and its fascinating rock formations.Enjoy breathtaking views of the misty hills and valleys.Witness the unique biodiversity of Mawphlang Sacred Forest.Escape the city chaos and relax in serene natural surroundings.Top Things to Do in Mawsynram:Visit Mawjymbuin Cave to see its famous Shivling-shaped stalagmite.Explore the Mawphlang Sacred Forest, rich in flora and mythology.Take nature walks to enjoy the panoramic views of Mawsynram’s lush landscape.Visit the famous waterfalls of Meghalaya and nearby hidden gems.Enjoy local food and hot tea at small roadside stalls during rainy weather.Best Time to Visit:September to November and March to May are the best times to visit Mawsynram. The weather is cool and pleasant for exploring. The monsoon in Meghalaya (June to August) brings heavy rainfall, enhancing the area’s greenery and waterfalls, but travel can be challenging.Location and How to Reach:Mawsynram is 61 km from Shillong and is easily accessible by road. Private taxis or buses can be taken from Shillong or Guwahati, the nearest airport and railway station.Suggested Read: Snorkeling in Meghalaya4. Tura – The Gateway to Garo HillsTura is one of the most picturesque and offbeat gems in Meghalaya. As the cultural heart of the Garo Hills, it is one of the top places to visit in the Garo Hills of Meghalaya. Tura offers breathtaking landscapes, lush green forests, and scenic valleys. It is a treasure trove of natural beauty, wildlife, and cultural heritage, making it one of the most unique hill stations places in Meghalaya. Some of the must-visit places to visit in Tura include Nokrek National Park, Siju Caves, and Pelga Falls. With its quiet vibe and untouched charm, Tura is perfect for travelers seeking an offbeat escape.Why Visit:Explore Nokrek Biosphere Reserve, a UNESCO World Heritage Site.Discover the ancient limestone Siju Caves.Experience the vibrant Garo culture and traditions.Enjoy stunning views from Tura Peak.Witness exotic wildlife and birds in lush natural surroundings.Top Things to Do in Tura:Trek to Tura Peak for panoramic views of the valley and hills.Visit Nokrek National Park, home to the rare red panda and diverse flora and fauna.Explore Siju Caves, one of the longest caves in India.Relax at Pelga Falls, a perfect picnic spot.Take part in local festivals like Wangala, the harvest festival of the Garos.Best Time to Visit:October to March is the best time to visit Tura, as the weather is cool and comfortable for outdoor activities and exploration. Avoid the monsoon season (June to September) due to heavy rainfall, which can make travel challenging.Location and How to Reach:Tura is about 323 km from Guwahati and can be reached by road via buses or taxis. The nearest airport is in Guwahati, from where travelers can take private cabs to Tura.Suggested Read: Ziplining in Meghalaya: Guide to Thrilling Experience5. Jowai – The Hidden Gem of MeghalayaLocated in the picturesque hills in Meghalaya, Jowai is a peaceful town and a must-visit place in the Jaintia Hills district, known for its stunning natural beauty and cultural richness. Surrounded by rolling green hills, crystal-clear rivers, and lush valleys, it’s one of the best hill stations to visit near Shillong that offers an offbeat escape for travelers. Places to visit in Jowai include Krang Suri Waterfalls, Lalong Park, and the unique Thadlaskein Lake. Known for its vibrant traditions and local festivals, Jowai is a perfect blend of nature and culture, making it a must-visit destination.Why Visit:Witness the breathtaking beauty of Krang Suri Waterfalls.Explore the peaceful Lalong Park, surrounded by lush greenery.Enjoy a tranquil boat ride on Thadlaskein Lake.Immerse yourself in the unique culture of the Jaintia tribes.Experience the untouched charm of Meghalaya’s countryside.Top Things to Do in Jowai:Take a refreshing dip at Krang Suri Waterfalls.Visit the sacred Durga Temple, an important religious site.Enjoy a nature walk at Lalong Park with stunning valley views.Explore Nartiang Monoliths, one of the largest collections of monoliths in the world.Attend local festivals to experience Jaintia traditions and dances.Best Time to Visit:The best time to visit Jowai is from October to April, when the weather is pleasant and perfect for sightseeing. During the monsoon (June to September), the waterfalls and greenery are at their best, but heavy rainfall can make travel tricky.Location and How to Reach:Jowai is around 64 km from Shillong and can be reached by road via taxis or buses. The nearest airport and railway station are in Guwahati, from where you can travel to Shillong and then to Jowai by road.6. . Nongjrong – The Sunrise Paradise of MeghalayaNongjrong is of the best places to watch a sunrise and a famous hill stations of Meghalaya. It is a picturesque village that has become a favorite for sunrise lovers and adventure activities in Meghalaya like trekking.. Located in the East Khasi Hills district, this hidden gem is known for its misty mornings, rolling clouds, and stunning views. Nongjrong offers a unique experience of watching the sun rise over a sea of clouds, a sight that has captivated photographers and travelers alike. While less commercialized compared to other popular hill stations in Meghalaya, Nongjrong is a perfect spot for those seeking peace and natural beauty.Why Visit:Witness breathtaking sunrises above the clouds.Enjoy the serene beauty of Meghalaya’s untouched countryside.Explore the local Khasi culture and lifestyle.Perfect for photography and nature enthusiasts.Escape the hustle and bustle for a peaceful getaway.Top Things to Do in Nongjrong:Wake up early to experience Nongjrong’s iconic sunrise.Enjoy trekking in Meghalaya through the village and surrounding hills.Interact with the friendly Khasi locals and learn about their traditions.Enjoy quiet moments amidst pristine landscapes.Capture mesmerizing views of clouds rolling over the valleys.Best Time to Visit:The best time to visit Nongjrong is from October to April, especially during the winter months, when the skies are clear for spectacular sunrises. The monsoon season (June to September) brings heavy rainfall but enhances the greenery, making the hills even more picturesque.Location and How to Reach:Nongjrong is about 56 km from Shillong and can be reached by road via private taxis or shared cabs. The nearest airport and railway station are in Guwahati, from where you can travel to Shillong and then onward to Nongjrong.Suggested Read:Moopun Waterfalls in Meghalaya: To-Do, Best time, How to reach7. Kongthong – The Whistling Village of MeghalayaNestled in the rolling hills in Meghalaya, Kongthong is a unique and enchanting village famous for its ancient tradition of whistling. Often referred to as the “Whistling Village,” Kongthong stands out among the famous hill stations of Meghalaya for its fascinating culture and breathtaking beauty. For travellers looking for offbeat Hill Stations To Visit Near Shillong, Kongthong is the place for you!Every person in this village has a distinct tune or melody assigned to them instead of a name, a tradition that has been passed down for generations. Surrounded by lush greenery, misty hills, and scenic valleys, Kongthong offers visitors an immersive cultural experience along with peace and nature. Visiting this village is one of the unique things to do in Meghalaya.Why Visit:Experience the unique whistling tradition that is globally recognized.Enjoy the serene beauty of Meghalaya’s lush countryside.Discover local Khasi traditions and their harmonious way of life.Trek through scenic trails in this top hill station places in MeghalayaEscape the crowds and connect with nature in an untouched setting.Top Things to Do in Kongthong Village:Learn about the whistling tradition and try it yourself.Explore the natural beauty through guided village walks and treks.Interact with the friendly Khasi locals and learn about their culture.Visit nearby waterfalls and streams for some quiet time in nature.Enjoy simple, delicious local food prepared by the villagers.Best Time to Visit:The best time to visit Kongthong is from October to April, when the weather is cool and perfect for outdoor activities. During the monsoon season (June to September), this top hill stations in Meghalaya becomes even greener, but heavy rains can make trekking and travel difficult.Location and How to Reach:Kongthong is located around 60 km from Shillong and can be reached by road via taxis or shared cabs. The nearest airport and railway station are in Guwahati, from where you can travel to Shillong and then to Kongthong.Get exclusive travel insights & updates into your inbox!Subscribe *By clicking subscribe you'll receive emails from WanderOn.You have already subscribed our newsletter!Thanks for Subscribing our newsletter!Shrutika Parab★★★★★24 May 2024“Thank you Team Wanderon for the amazing Ladakh Experience.
